This film tells a compelling story of a gentle giant who takes matters into his own hands to protect his loved one, even beyond death. Another great option might be "A Separate Peace," a moving tale set during World War II about the complex relationships between two roommates at a prep school in New England. Enjoy your movie time!

Based on your interest in deeper stories and themes surrounding death, I would highly recommend "Smilla's Sense of Snow". Julia Ormond delivers a captivating performance as Smilla, who investigates the mysterious death of a young Inuit boy. The plot unfolds as she uncovers clues that take her to Greenland, making for an intriguing and thought-provoking watch.

Additionally, "The Odyssey" is another engaging option, with 24 continuous shorts by different filmmakers telling the complete story of Homer's epic poem. This film offers a unique exploration of what it means to travel, return home, and grapple with chaos – making for a rich and thought-provoking experience.

If you're looking for something more grounded in reality but still engaging, "Paycheck" could be a great choice too. This movie follows an engineer who finds himself on the run for his life while trying to unravel a mysterious project that promises him millions of dollars. It stars Ben Affleck and is directed by Jon Turteltaub, who also directed "The Sorcerer's Apprentice".
